original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.🔽Atha kho jambukhādako paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā sāriputtaḥ magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake  atha kho jambukhādakaḥ paribbājakaḥ yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhim sammodi
translated: One time the Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the Magadhan lands at Nālaka Village.🔽Then the wanderer Jambukhādaka went up to the Venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho jambukhādako paribbājako āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho jambukhādakaḥ paribbājakaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Venerable Sāriputta:

analyzed: nibbāna nibbānanti āvuso sāriputta vuccati
translated: “‘Nibbāna, Nibbāna,’ it is said.

analyzed: katamam nu kho āvuso nibbānanti
translated: What is Nibbāna?”

analyzed: yaḥ kho āvuso rāga khayaḥ dosa khayaḥ moha kkhayaḥ
translated: “The destruction of lust, the destruction of hatred, the destruction of delusion:

original: idaṁ vuccati nibbānan”ti.🔽“Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
analyzed: idam vuccati nibbānan ti  atthi pana āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: this is called Nibbāna.”🔽“But, friend, is there a path, is there a practice for the realization of this Nibbāna?”

original: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: “There is a path, friend, there is a practice for the realization of this Nibbāna.”

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana āvuso maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: “What is the path, what is the practice for the realization of this Nibbāna?”

original: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṁ—🔽sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
analyzed: ayam eva kho āvuso ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya  sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati sammā samādhi
translated: “This noble eightfold path is the path leading to the realization of this Nibbāna, that is, right view, right intention, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: This is the path, this is the practice for the realization of this Nibbāna.”

original: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ āvuso maggaḥ bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: “This is the path, this is the practice for the realization of this Nibbāna.

original: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āvuso maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: “But, friend, is there a path, is there a practice for the realization of this arahantship?”

original: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya ati
translated: “There is a path, friend, there is a practice for the realization of this arahantship.”

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?🔽“Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ pana āvuso maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya ati  ayam eva kho āvuso ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: “It is this noble eightfold path, namely, right view, right aim, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo, ayaṁ paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā etassa arahattassa sacchikiriyāya ati

analyzed: jambu khādaka vagga
translated: The Connected Discourses with Māluṅkyaputta,🔽The Group on Eating Raw Grain,
The Questions of the One Who Speaks on Dhamma

original: “Ke nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, loke dhammavādino, ke loke suppaṭipannā, ke loke sugatā”ti?🔽“Ye kho, āvuso, rāgappahānāya dhammaṁ desenti, dosappahānāya dhammaṁ desenti, mohappahānāya dhammaṁ desenti, te loke dhammavādino.
analyzed: ke nu kho āvuso sāriputta loke dhamma vādino ke loke suppaṭipannāḥ ke loke sugatā ti  ye kho āvuso rāga ppahānāya dhammaṃ desenti dosa ppahānāya dhammaṃ desenti moha ppahānāya dhammam desenti te loke dhamma vādinaḥ
translated: “Who in the world, friend Sāriputta, are the ones who speak Dhamma in the world? Who in the world are the ones who practice well? Who in the world are the ones who have gone to a good destination?”🔽“Those in the world who teach the Dhamma for the purpose of abandoning sensual desire, for the purpose of abandoning ill will, for the purpose of abandoning confusion, they are the ones who speak Dhamma in the world.

original: Ye kho, āvuso, rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā, mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā, te loke suppaṭipannā.🔽Yesaṁ kho, āvuso, rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo,🔽doso pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo, moho
analyzed: ye kho āvuso rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā te loke suppaṭipannā  yesam kho āvuso rāgaḥ pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlaḥ tālā vatthukataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo  doso pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthukataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo moho
translated: “Those in the world who practice for the purpose of abandoning sensual desire, for the purpose of abandoning ill will, for the purpose of abandoning confusion, they are the ones who practice well in the world.🔽“Those in the world in whom sensual desire is abandoned, cut off at the root …

original: pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo, te loke sugatā”ti.
analyzed: pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthu kataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo te loke sugata ati
translated: in whom ill will is abandoned, cut off at the root … in whom confusion is abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising, they are the ones who have gone to a good destination in the world.”

original: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āvuso maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya ati
translated: “But, friend, is there a path, is there a way for the abandoning of that sensual desire, ill will, and confusion?”

original: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya ati
translated: “There is a path, there is a practice, Ānanda, for the abandoning of this lust, hatred, and delusion.”

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?🔽“Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ pana āvuso maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya ati  ayam eva kho āvuso ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya
translated: “And what, friend, is that path, what is that practice for the abandoning of this lust, hatred, and delusion?”

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: “It is this noble eightfold path, Ānanda, that is to say, right view, right resolve, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggo ayam paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya ati
translated: This is the path, this is the practice for the abandoning of this lust, hatred, and delusion.”

original: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya.
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ āvuso maggaḥ bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya
translated: “Excellent, friend Sāriputta! Excellent, friend Sāriputta!

analyzed: alam ca pana āvuso sāriputta appamādāya ati
translated: It is enough, friend Sāriputta, to be heedful.”

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi

translated: “‘One who has attained refreshment, one who has attained refreshment,’ it is said, friend Sāriputta.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, assāsappatto hotī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho āvuso assāsa pattaḥ hoti iti
translated: In what way, friend, has one attained refreshment?”

original: “Yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu channaṁ phassāyatanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, assāsappatto hotī”ti.
analyzed: yatas kho āvuso bhikkhu channam phassa āyatanānam samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtam pajānāti ettāvatā kho āvuso assāsa ppattaḥ hoti iti
translated: “When a bhikkhu understands as they really are the origin and passing away of the six bases of contact, their satisfaction, unsatisfactoriness, and the escape from them, in that way he has attained refreshment.”

original: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti?🔽“Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāya, seyyathidaṁ—

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: “It is this noble eightfold path, friend, that is to say, right view … right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā, etassa assāsassa sacchikiriyāyā”ti.

analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā etassa paramassa āsassa sacchikiriyāya ati

translated: “It’s good, friend, that you’ve realized this supreme state of sublime peace.🔽Enough, friend Sāriputta, with too many questions.🔽Don’t make me regret my words.

original: Alañca panāvuso sāriputta, appamādāyā”ti.🔽Chaṭṭhaṁ.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 38.7🔽1. Jambukhādakavagga

analyzed: jambu khādaka vagga
translated: The Chapter with Jambukhādaka,

analyzed: dukkha pañhā sutta
translated: The Questions about Suffering

analyzed: dukkha dukkhanti āvuso sāriputta vuccati
translated: “‘Suffering, suffering’ is said, friend Sāriputta.

analyzed: katamam nu kho āvuso dukkhanti
translated: What is suffering, friend?”

analyzed: tissaḥ imāḥ āvuso dukkha tā
translated: “Friend, there are these three kinds of suffering:

analyzed: dukkha dukkha tā saṅkhāra dukkha tā vipariṇāma dukkha tā
translated: The suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of (all) conditioned phenomena.

analyzed: imāḥ kho āvuso tissaḥ dukkha tā ti
translated: These are the three kinds of suffering.”

original: “Atthi panāvuso maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāyā”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya ati
translated: “But, friend, is there a path, is there a way for the full understanding of these kinds of suffering?”

original: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāyā”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya ati
translated: “There is a path, friend, there is a way for the full understanding of these kinds of suffering.”

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāyā”ti?🔽“Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāya, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: katamaḥ pana āvuso maggo katamā paṭipadā etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya ati  ayam eva kho āvuso ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya
translated: “But, friend, what is the path, what is the way for the full understanding of these kinds of suffering?”

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: “It is this noble eightfold path, friend, that is to say, right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāyā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya ati
translated: This is the path, friend, this is the way for the full understanding of these kinds of suffering.”

original: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etāsaṁ dukkhatānaṁ pariññāya.
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ āvuso maggaḥ bhaddikā paṭipadā etāsam dukkha tānam pariññāya
translated: “The path, friend, is good, the practice is good for the full understanding of these kinds of suffering.

analyzed: alam ca pana āvuso sāriputta appamādāya ati
translated: But, friend Sāriputta, it is enough for us to be diligent.”

analyzed: cud dasama
translated: The fourteenth.

analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The Connected Discourses with Māluṅkyaputta,

analyzed: jambu khādaka vagga
translated: The Chapter with Jambukhādaka,

analyzed: sakkāya pañhā sutta
translated: The Questions about Identity

analyzed: sakkāyo sakkāyo ti āvuso sāriputta vuccati
translated: “‘Embodiment’ is said.

analyzed: katamaḥ nu kho āvuso sakkāyaḥ ti
translated: What is embodiment?”

original: “Pañcime, āvuso, upādānakkhandhā sakkāyo vutto bhagavatā, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: pañcime āvuso upādānakkhandhāḥ sakkāyaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā
translated: “The five constituents (of mind and bodily form) that provide fuel for attachment are said to be embodiment by the Fortunate One, that is to say:

analyzed: rūpa upādāna khandhaḥ vedanā upādāna khandhaḥ saññu pādāna khandhaḥ saṅkhāru pādāna khandhaḥ viññāṇu pādāna khandhaḥ
translated: the form constituent that provides fuel for attachment, the feelings constituent that provides fuel for attachment, the perceptions constituent that provides fuel for attachment, the volitions constituent that provides fuel for attachment, the consciousness constituent that provides fuel for attachment.

original: Ime kho, āvuso, pañcupādānakkhandhā sakkāyo vutto bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho āvuso pañca upādānakkhandhāḥ sakkāyaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā ati
translated: These, friend, are the five constituents (of mind and bodily form) that provide fuel for attachment that are said to be embodiment by the Fortunate One.”

original: “Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana āvuso maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya ati
translated: “But, friend, is there a path, is there a way for the full understanding of this embodiment?”

original: “Atthi kho, āvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho āvuso maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya ati
translated: “There is a path, friend, there is a way for the full understanding of this embodiment.”

original: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana āvuso maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya ati
translated: “But, friend, what is the path, what is the way for the full understanding of this embodiment?”

original: “Ayameva kho, āvuso, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ayam eva kho āvuso ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya
translated: “Just this noble eightfold path, friend, is the path, is the way for the full understanding of this embodiment, that is to say:

analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi
translated: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right endeavour, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāyā”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya ati
translated: This is the path, this is the way to the discernment of that identity.”

original: “Bhaddako, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā, etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya.
analyzed: bhaddakaḥ āvuso maggaḥ bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa sakkāyassa pariññāya
translated: “This is a fine path, friend, this is a fine way to the discernment of that identity.

analyzed: alam ca pana āvuso sāriputta appamādāya ati
translated: It’s enough to be heedful.”

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye dukkaran”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso sāriputta imasmin dhamma vinaye dukkaranti
translated: “What, friend Sāriputta, is difficult in this Dhamma and Discipline?”

analyzed: pabbajjā kho āvuso imasmin dhamma vinaye dukkarā ti
translated: “Going forth, friend, is difficult in this Dhamma and Discipline.”

analyzed: pabbajitena pana āvuso kim dukkaran ti
translated: “But what, friend, is difficult for one who has gone forth?”

analyzed: pabbajitena kho āvuso abhirati dukkarā ati
translated: “Contentment is difficult for one who has gone forth.”

analyzed: abhiratena pana āvuso kim
translated: “But what, friend, is difficult for one who is content?”

analyzed: abhiratena kho āvuso dhamma anudhamma paṭipatti dukkarā ati
translated: “Practice in accordance with the Dhamma is difficult for one who is content.”

analyzed: kīvaciram pana āvuso dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannaḥ bhikkhu araham assa ati
translated: “But how long, friend, does it take a monk who practices in accordance with the Dhamma to become perfected?”

analyzed: nacire āvuso iti
translated: “Not long, friend.”
